articles.title: The Neanderthal Handshake: Unraveling the Genetic Origins of “Viking Disease” - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Dupuytren's disease, a hand disorder common among Northern Europeans, is found to have genetic links to Neanderthals, according to a study in Molecular Biology and Evolution. Three of the 61 genetic risk variants for the disease identified by researchers are …
articles.content:
A ring finger locked in a bent position as seen in Dupuytrens disease, colloquially known as the Viking disease. Credit: Hugo Zeberg/ Molecular Biology and Evolution
